result.name: children-in-low-income-families1
result.notes:
HM Revenue and Customs and the Department for Work and Pensions have published new Official experimental statistics called "[Children in low income families: local area statistics 2014/15 to 2018/19](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics-201415-to-201819/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics-201415-to-201819)". Results can be downloaded from [DWP Stat-xplore data tool](https://stat-xplore.dwp.gov.uk/webapi/jsf/login.xhtml).

This data set includes summaries of results for Calderdale and will be updated annually in March.
result.title: Children in low income families

resources.description: Number and percentage of children in low income families 2018/19 by ward. Data source: HM Revenue and Customs and DWP "[Children in low income families: local area statistics 2014/15 to 2018/19](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics-201415-to-201819/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics-201415-to-201819)" published 26 March 2020. Next update expected March 2021.
resources.name: Children in Low Income Families 2018/19 by ward
Children in Low Income Families 2018/19 by ward

resources.description: Visualisation of open geographic datasets published on Open Street Map,  [Data Mill North](http://datamillnorth.org/)  and  [Calderdale Dataworks](https://dataworks.calderdale.gov.uk/). Number and percentage of children in low income families 2018/19 by ward. Data source: HM Revenue and Customs and DWP "[Children in low income families: local area statistics 2014/15 to 2018/19](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics-201415-to-201819/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics-201415-to-201819)" published 26 March 2020. Next update expected March 2021.
resources.name: ODI Leeds Data Mapper - Children in Low Income Families 2018/19 by ward

resources.description: Selected tables and graphs showing the number and proportion of children in low income families in Calderdale between 2014/15 and 2018/9. Ward and LSOA (Lower layer super output area) summaries are included. Data source HM Revenue and Customs and DWP "[Children in low income families: local area statistics 2014/15 to 2018/19](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics-201415-to-201819/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics-201415-to-201819)" published 26 March 2020 and updated 30 June 2020. Next update expected March 2021.
resources.name: Children in low income families local areas statistics 2014/15 to 2018/19

resources.description: Data set of number and proportion of children in low income families in Calderdale by LSOA (Lower layer super output area) from 2014/15 to 2018/19. Data source HM Revenue and Customs and DWP "[Children in low income families: local area statistics 2014/15 to 2018/19](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics-201415-to-201819/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics-201415-to-201819)" published 26 March 2020. Next update expected March 2021.
resources.name: Children in low income families 2014/15 to 2018/19 by LSOA

resources.description: Data set of number and proportion of children in low income families in Calderdale by ward from 2014/15 to 2018/19. Data source HM Revenue and Customs and DWP "[Children in low income families: local area statistics 2014/15 to 2018/19](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics-201415-to-201819/children-in-low-income-families-local-area-statistics-201415-to-201819)" published 26 March 2020. Next update expected March 2021.
resources.name: Children in low income families 2014/15 to 2018/19 by ward

resources.description: This interactive dashboard is one of a series within the Calderdale Anti-Poverty dashboards. It shows the proportion of children in low income families in each ward and LSOA (lower layer super output area) in 2018/19. The data comes from 'Children in low income families: local area statistics' data set published by the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) and HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC), in March 2020.
resources.name: Calderdale Anti-Poverty Dashboards: Children in poverty
